elements.label: sub_sub_sec
elements.text:
1
DEFINITIONS

elements.label: para
elements.text: The terms beginning with a capital letter in this request for proposals shall have the following meaning:

elements.label: para
elements.text:
"Applicant (s)" means individually each of the candidates which apply to the technical advisory services for
Kanona Project.

elements.label: para
elements.text: “Bid” means the offer submitted by the Bidder.

elements.label: para
elements.text:
“Bidder (s)” means any individual entity or consortium submitting an offer for the engineering,
procurement and construction as well the Operation and Maintenance of Kanona Project.

elements.label: para
elements.text: "CAPEX" means capital expenditures.

elements.label: para
elements.text: “Client” means “Masen” on behalf of the JV before the creation of the JV and refers to the JV once created.

elements.label: para
elements.text: "Consortium" means any group of companies or consortium acting as an Applicant.

elements.label: para
elements.text:
"Contract" means the standard terms and conditions attached to these Terms of Reference to be signed
between the Technical Advisor and the Client.

elements.label: para
elements.text: "EPC" means engineering, procurement and construction.

elements.label: para
elements.text:
"Evaluation Committee" means the advisory committee in charge of the supervision of the overall process
of the Project.

elements.label: para
elements.text:
“Feasibility Study” means the feasibility study provided by Masen for Kanona Project, including (i) Site
Assessment, (ii) the conceptual design and (iii) interconnection scheme of Kanona PV Plant.

elements.label: para
elements.text: "Financial Advisor" means the advisor providing financial advisory services for the Project.

elements.label: para
elements.text: "International Financial Institution (s)"or "IFI(s)" means

elements.label: para
elements.text:
(a)
Those financial institutions established in more than one country and subject to international law,
such as the European Union represented by the European Commission, the African Development
Bank, the European Investment Bank and the World Bank Group; and

elements.label: para
elements.text:
(b)
Those financial institutions which undertake all types of activities, whether or not for profit, receiving
governmental financial support or not, for the purpose of promoting development, through the
granting capital or other credit facilities, such as the Agence Française de Développement and KfW
Bankengruppe;

elements.label: para
elements.text: which, in either case, could provide financing for the Project.

elements.label: para
elements.text:
“Joint-Venture” or ”JV” means the Joint-Venture dedicated to develop renewable energy Program in Zambia.
The JV will be held equally by Masen and ZESCO (50% each).

elements.label: para
elements.text: “Kanona Project” or “Project”: means the development of Kanona PV plant.

elements.label: para
elements.text: “Kanona PV Plant” means the PV plant that will be developed within Kanona Site.

elements.label: para
elements.text: “Kanona Site” or “Site” means Kanona site.

elements.label: para
elements.text: "LCOE" means the levelized cost of electricity.

elements.label: header
elements.text:
"Masen" a limited liability company, recorded in the Register of Companies of Rabat under number 79835,
with its registered office at Complexe Zénith Rabat, n° 50 Rocade Sud, Rabat-Casablanca, Immeubles A, B,
C et D Souissi, Rabat, represented by Mr. Mustapha Bakkoury, in his capacity as President .

elements.label: para
elements.text: "O&M" means operation and maintenance.

elements.label: para
elements.text: "OPEX" means operational expenditures.

elements.label: para
elements.text: "Partners" means the entities that are involved in the development of the Project such as ZESCO, IFIs, etc.

elements.label: para
elements.text: “Plant” means Kanona PV Plant.

elements.label: para
elements.text:
"Power Purchase Agreement" or "PPA" means, in relation to the Project, the power purchase agreement
for development, design, financing, construction, test, commissioning, ownership, operation and
maintenance of a power plant to be entered into between ZESCO and the project company.

elements.label: para
elements.text:
"Prequalification" or "RFQ" means the selection process by the project company of the entities which have
registered their interest to complete the Project.

elements.label: para
elements.text:
"Preferred Bidder" means the Bidder that is selected as having submitted the lowest evaluated financial
proposal in relation to the Project and whose bid is substantially compliant with the requirements of the
Request for Proposals for the engineering, procurement and construction as well as the operation and
maintenance of the Project.

elements.label: para
elements.text:
“Project Agreements” means, in relation to the Project, any agreement to be entered into by the Preferred
Bidder(s) in relation to such Project.

"Request for Proposals" or "RFP" means the request for proposals to select the EPC that will be in charge
of the engineering, design, procurement, construction and operation and maintenance of the Plant.

elements.label: para
elements.text: "Technical Advisor" or "TA" means the advisor providing technical advisory services for the Project.

elements.label: para
elements.text: " Technical Specifications" or "TS" means the technical specifications of the RFP provided by Masen.

elements.label: para
elements.text:
“TA Request for Proposals" or "RFPTA" means the request for proposals to select the technical advisor that
will have to assist the Client in the development of Kanona Project.

elements.label: para
elements.text:
"Terms of Reference" or "ToR" means these request for proposals related to technical advisory services for
the Project.

elements.label: para
elements.text: “Testing Requirements” means the testing requirement of the Plant provided by Masen.

elements.label: para
elements.text:
"Transaction Advisor" means the advisor providing financial, legal, tax and as applicable accounting
advisory services for the Project.

elements.label: para
elements.text:
“ZESCO” means ZESCO LIMITED, a company organized and existing under the laws of Zambia incorporated
under the Companies Act, Chapter 388, having its principal office at ZESCO Limited Head Office Premises,
Stand Number 6949, Great East Road, P. O. Box 33304, 10101, Lusaka, Zambia, registered with the
companies’ registry of Lusaka under number 17475.

elements.label: sub_sub_sec
elements.text:
2
BACKGROUND

elements.label: sub_sub_sec
elements.text: 2.1 CONTEXT

elements.label: para
elements.text:
On March 2018, Moroccan Agency of Sustainable Energy (“Masen”) and ZESCO signed a framework agreement
to materialize the willingness to enter into a partnership to develop, in Zambia, solar plants, wind power plants,
hydropower plants and geothermal plants with a total capacity target of 450 MW (“Program”).

elements.label: para
elements.text: The Program includes several projects that will be:

elements.label: para
elements.text:
-
co-developed by Masen and ZESCO through a Joint-Venture (“JV”) held equally by Masen and ZESCO
(50% each); and
-
carried out by a special purpose company expected to be fully owned by Masen and ZESCO.

elements.label: para
elements.text:
The first project to be developed under the Program shall be a solar Photovoltaic Project, located on Kanona
(the “Project” or “Kanona Project”) with a capacity target around [one hundred (100)] MWAC.

elements.label: para
elements.text: 2.2 Moroccan Agency of Sustainable Energy (“Masen”)

elements.label: para
elements.text:
Masen is the State-owned entity created in 2010 to implement and manage the Kingdom of Morocco’s
renewable energy program, and has in such capacity led the development program of integrated renewable
energy projects aiming at creating an additional 3 000 MW of renewable energy power generation capacity by
2020 and 6 000 MW by 2030.

elements.label: para
elements.text: Masen’s ownership structure is split between four (04) equal shareholders’ participation:

elements.label: para
elements.text:
-
Government of Morocco;
-
Office National de l’Eau et l’Electricité (“ONEE”), the Moroccan state water and power utility;
-
Fonds Hassan II, a fund supporting the Kingdom’s social and economic development; and
-
Société d’Investissements Energétiques, a fund supporting the Kingdom’s renewable energy program.

elements.label: para
elements.text:
Internationally, Masen aims to be the preferred partner for any country wishing to make renewable energy a
priority for its socioeconomic development. Masen has already signed several partnership agreements with
African countries for the development of renewable energies.

elements.label: para
elements.text: Key roles of Masen include:

elements.label: para
elements.text:
-
Development of integrated renewable power plants with all the attendant activities: from qualifying
sites to the design, the structuring and raising of funds, the construction of power plants and their
related infrastructure as well as their operation and maintenance;
-
Contribution to the development of expertise (industrial integration, R&D and training);
-
Propose any solutions to national and international partners who aim to develop Projects related to
renewable energy sector.

elements.label: para
elements.text:
Masen has created a fully-owned subsidiary, Masen Capital, to hold notably a stake as deemed appropriate in
the project companies in charge of the development of renewable projects.

elements.label: sub_sub_sec
elements.text: 2.3 ZESCO LIMITED

elements.label: para
elements.text:
ZESCO LTD is a public utility wholly owned by the Government of the Republic of Zambia, and is a vertically
integrated company established in 1970 with the purpose of generating, transmitting, distributing and supplying
electricity in Zambia.

elements.label: header
elements.text:
ZESCO is governed by the Board of Directors who are appointed by the shareholder, the Government of the
Republic of Zambia through the Industrial Development Corporation Limited. Corporate Governance is intended
to support the relationship of trust between ZESCO and its stakeholders. The company’s governance system links
with its business strategy to help achieve business goals, creating sustainable value in the long-term for
shareholders.

elements.label: para
elements.text:
The Company has a total installed capacity 2 341 MW with 1 861 MW owned by ZESCO, while 360 MW through
its subsidiary Kariba North Bank Power Corporation and 120 MW through the joint-venture Itezhi-Tezhi Power
Corporation Ltd (ITPC).

elements.label: para
elements.text:
In 2017, the Board and Management ushered in a new vision “to be the hub of electricity trading in the region
by 2025”, that will carry the employees across the value chain to work towards a shared vision. To that effect,
interconnectors to all the eight neighboring countries are now part of the power system master plan. The four
key focus areas of ZESCO are as follows:

elements.label: para
elements.text:
-
Strengthening the core business;
-
Delivering value to customers by giving them an exceptional experience;
-
Use of Innovative Technology; and
-
Unlocking the value of non-core investments.

elements.label: header
elements.text:
3.1
Presentation of the Project

elements.label: sub_sub_sec
elements.text:
3
TERMS OF REFERENCE

elements.label: para
elements.text:
ZESCO and Masen will develop in
Kanona a PV plant with a capacity of
around [100] MWAC.

elements.label: fig
elements.text: ![Figure]()

elements.label: para
elements.text:
Kanona is located in Serenje district
about 1km from the junction of Great
north road (T2) and D225 (Road leading
to Lusiwasi and Msoro).

elements.label: para
elements.text:
The Site is 204 hectares (Ha), located at
latitude of-13.058425°, and a longitude
of 30.651624°.

elements.label: para
elements.text: The expected timetable of the Project is summarized below:

elements.label: para
elements.text:
Launch of Pre-
qualification
process

elements.label: para
elements.text:
Launch of request
for
proposal
process

elements.label: para
elements.text:
Selection
of
the Preferred
Bidder(s)

elements.label: para
elements.text:
Scheduled
commercial operation
date

elements.label: para
elements.text:
Indicative dates
[Q3 2020]
[Q4 2020]
[Q2 2021]
[Q3 2022]

elements.label: para
elements.text:
3.2
Missions

elements.label: para
elements.text:
To successfully meet the above-mentioned objectives, the Client intends to appoint a qualified international
technical advisor (“Technical Advisor” or “TA”) for the Project. The Technical Advisor will manage and
supervise the entire technical process from the due diligence of the Feasibility Study conducted by Masen
up to the signing of the Project agreements including the request for proposals (“RFP”), the selection of the
Preferred Bidder(s), the effectiveness of the main contracts and the financial close.

elements.label: para
elements.text:
The terms of reference, ("ToR") covers the following missions:
-
Mission A: Technical assistance to develop Kanona PV Plant under an Engineering, Procurement and
Construction (“EPC”) scheme;
-
Mission B: Technical assistance to perform specific assignments as needed and as defined by Client
(optional).

elements.label: para
elements.text:
3.3
Scope of work

elements.label: para
elements.text:
3.3.1
Mission A- Technical assistance to develop Kanona PV Plant under an Engineering, Procurement
and Construction (“EPC”) scheme.

elements.label: para
elements.text:
The Technical Advisor will be required to provide technical assistance to the Client considering the
development of Kanona PV Plant under an EPC scheme.

elements.label: header
elements.text: Mission A is divided into three (3) sections:

elements.label: para
elements.text: Mission A

elements.label: para
elements.text: Technical assistance in relation to development of PV Plant under EPC scheme

elements.label: para
elements.text: Section I

elements.label: para
elements.text: Feasibility Study due diligence

elements.label: para
elements.text: Section II

elements.label: para
elements.text: Preparation of documents and process management of request for proposal (“RFP”)

elements.label: para
elements.text: Section III

elements.label: para
elements.text: Selection of the Preferred Bidder(s), awarding of contracts and negotiation of all Project Agreements

elements.label: para
elements.text:
It is noteworthy that the deliverables of each section will not mandatory follow the order of sections as
described above.

elements.label: para
elements.text: 3.3.1.1 Section I: Feasibility Study Due Diligence

elements.label: para
elements.text:
The Technical Advisor shall perform a due diligence of the Feasibility Study (“Feasibility Study Due
Diligence”) provided by Masen. The TA shall therefore update and complete where necessary the aforesaid
study to provide a final feasibility report (“Final Feasability Study report”).

elements.label: para
elements.text: The Feasibility Study to be provided to the TA is splitted into four sections as follow:

elements.label: para
elements.text:

Site Assessment: this section consists in the evaluation of the Site suitability for the development
of Kanona PV Plant. It covers an assessment of the physical Site data and constraints, including but
not limited to meteorological data, site qualification studies (Geotechnical, seismic and
topographic, Hydraulic and hydrological studies), access to the grid, as well as logistical access for
equipment supply.

Conceptual design: this section consists in (i) selecting technologies, components and configuration
of the Plant (ii) analyzing the energy production, (iii) defining the Plant needs in terms of auxiliary
power and water comsuption, (iv) and providing the Project plans and drawings.

Economic and Financial Analysis: in this section the estimation of the CAPEX and OPEX is provided.

Interconnection scheme: this section consists in providing Kanona interconnection scheme as well
as the relating grid impact study.

elements.label: para
elements.text:
The TA shall perform a detailed due diligence and complete the Feasability Study where dully necessary
with his own analysis. On this basis the TA shall identify inputs to elaborate RFP technical documents.

elements.label: para
elements.text:
The Technical Advisor will endorse the conclusions and recommendations of the Final Feasability Study
report in particular the inputs to the RFP documentation.

elements.label: para
elements.text: Deliverables of Section I:

elements.label: para
elements.text: The TA shall provide:

elements.label: header
elements.text: - Interim due diligence report including the modifications/changes proposed to be made

elements.label: header
elements.text:
on the Feasibility Study.
- Final Feasibility Study report including all changes and recommandations suggested by the

elements.label: para
elements.text:
TA.
- Presentation in Power Point version and synthesis in word version on the final version of

elements.label: para
elements.text: the Final Feasibility Study Report.

elements.label: para
elements.text: 3.3.1.2 Section II: Preparation of documents and process management of request for proposal

elements.label: sub_sub_sec
elements.text: (“RFP”)

elements.label: para
elements.text:
The Technical Advisor will ensure that qualified technical experts are available during this phase. The
Technical Advisor will be responsible for preparing the RFP documents and managing all technical
aspects of the competition process for the development of the Project under an EPC scheme. This
section will include the following:

elements.label: para
elements.text: 3.3.1.2.1 Task 1: Preparation of RFP documents and clarification process under an EPC scheme

elements.label: para
elements.text: A - Understand Client’s objectives

elements.label: para
elements.text: 1. Understand Client’s objectives in terms of risk allocation, timing and tariff structure.

elements.label: para
elements.text: 2. Attend to a RFP preparation workshop, that shall take place in location to be specified by the Client,

elements.label: para
elements.text:
with other advisors to discuss and debate different topics related to the RFP amongst others the risk
allocation, the main evaluation criteria, the PPA payment mechanism, commissioning plan of the Plant
including the relevant testing requirements.

elements.label: para
elements.text: 3. Draft a memorandum of meeting (“MoM”), after this meeting, and provide the requested analysis as

elements.label: para
elements.text:
well as the needed documents.

B - Request for Proposals (and clarifications)

elements.label: para
elements.text: 4. Assist Client in defining the overall bid process. The Technical Advisor will specify and provide the key

elements.label: para
elements.text:
milestones to be achieved (including critical paths) and the associated deadlines, and will ensure that
all technical aspects of the bid process are covered. The Technical Advisor will provide
recommendations to Client to avoid any delays during the bid process.

elements.label: para
elements.text: 5. Establish the methodology and the appropriate technical bid evaluation criteria for the evaluation of

elements.label: para
elements.text: the offers of the pre-qualified Bidders.

elements.label: para
elements.text: 6. Prepare all technical sections of the RFP documents which shall include the following sections:

elements.label: para
para
elements.text:
The RFP draft documents will be sent to Client and to the IFIs for approval. RFP will be considered final once
all comments of the Client and its Partners have been satisfactorily addressed.

elements.label: header
elements.text: 7. Define a clear and precise methodology for the evaluation of the bids. An evaluation grid/matrix shall

elements.label: header
elements.text:
be developed in a Microsoft Excel spreadsheet (using standard formatting) and shall include all criteria
for evaluating the technical performance of the bids.

elements.label: para
elements.text: 8. Provide technical information to the Transaction Advisor for use in the preparation of all draft Project

elements.label: para
elements.text:
agreements including PPA(s), interconnection agreement(s), interface agreement, direct agreements,
and any other relevant contractual document for the Project.

elements.label: para
elements.text: 9. Prepare the technical part of the EPC and O&M contracts to be included in the RfP.

elements.label: para
elements.text: 10. Propose new technology risk sheet (including requirements to mitigate new technology critical

elements.label: para
elements.text: components risks) to be included in the RFP documents.

elements.label: para
elements.text: 11. Provide technical inputs for the development of tariff mechanism and payment mechanism,

elements.label: para
elements.text:
development of penalty regime for below standard performance, and any other necessary technical
inputs as may be required by Bidders as part of the Project Agreements.

elements.label: para
elements.text: 12. Provide any necessary technical inputs as may be required by the Client, its advisors and Partners, as

elements.label: para
elements.text: part of the Project Agreements.

elements.label: para
elements.text: 13. Collect, prepare and update all technical information to be provided to the pre-qualified Bidders

elements.label: para
elements.text: through a specific Electronic Data Room.

elements.label: para
elements.text: 14. Perform a detailed due diligence and complete the Technical Specification as necessary to provide the

elements.label: para
elements.text:
final Technical Specifications (“Final Technical Specifications”). The Technical Specifications define,
among others, the overriding technical conditions, design and requirements for the Bidders’ to prepare
and submit a defined:

elements.label: para
elements.text:
-
general Site usage arrangements and Site plans,

elements.label: para
elements.text:
-
development and construction program for the Plant,

elements.label: para
elements.text:
-
operation and maintenance program for the Plant

elements.label: para
elements.text:
-
test and commissioning program for the Plant and

elements.label: para
elements.text:
-
Plant configuration, equipments, electrical interconnection scheme, etc.

elements.label: para
elements.text:
The TA will be required to adjust and amend the Technical Specifications and its annexes based on the
recommendations and the results of the Final Feasability Study, and the experience of his expert in
similar projects. The TA shall update the Final Technical Specifications as necessary and as requested
by the Client.

elements.label: para
elements.text: 15. Perform a detailed due diligence and complete the Testing Requirements for the Plant as necessary to

elements.label: para
elements.text:
provide a final Testing Requirements (“Final Testing Requirements”). The Testing Requirements set
forth the requirements and guidelines of tests to be carried out in relation to the Plant including but
not limited to factory tests, site tests, initial performance tests, and final performance tests, transfer
tests indicating for each test the pass or fail criteria.

elements.label: header
elements.text: 16. Identify location and distance and preliminary routing to electrical interconnection point, water

elements.label: header
elements.text: connections and sanitation.

elements.label: para
elements.text: 17. Assist Client in organizing Site visit for all potential Bidders: preparing technical presentation, draft

elements.label: para
elements.text: minutes of meetings, etc.

elements.label: para
elements.text: 18. Prepare answers to queries and requests for clarifications received from Bidders.

elements.label: para
elements.text: 19. Provide indicative technical assumptions (including CAPEX and OPEX) according to a specific format to

elements.label: para
elements.text:
be determined by the Transaction Advisor. These assumptions will be used as inputs of the financial
model to be developed by the Transaction Advisor.

elements.label: para
elements.text: 20. The Technical Advisor will endorse the requirements and recommendations of the Final Technical

elements.label: para
elements.text: Specifications and the Final Testing Requirements.

elements.label: para
elements.text: Deliverables of Section II - task 1:

elements.label: para
elements.text: The TA shall provide under task 1 the following deliverables :

elements.label: para
elements.text:

RFP workshop MoM, the requested analysis as well as the needed document.

elements.label: para
elements.text:

Planning of the overall bid process.

elements.label: para
elements.text:

Bid evaluation criteria, evaluation grid spreadsheet and methodology for the evaluation of
technical offers.

elements.label: para
elements.text:

Interim due diligence report including the modifications/changes proposed to be made on the
Technical Specifications (“TS”).

elements.label: para
elements.text:

Final Technical Specifications report including all changes and recommandations suggested by
the TA.

elements.label: para
elements.text:

Interim due diligence report including the modifications/changes proposed to be made on the
Testing Requirements.

elements.label: para
elements.text:

Final Testing Requirements report including all changes and recommandations suggested by the
TA.

elements.label: para
elements.text:

Preliminary and Final Technical input on the RFP Documents and on Project Agreements
including technical parts of the EPC and O&M contracts.

elements.label: para
elements.text:

Indicative technical assumptions dedicated to the financial model.

elements.label: sideinfo
elements.text:
3.3.1.2.2
Task 2: RFP Process Management and Evaluation

elements.label: para
elements.text: The TA shall be responsible of:

elements.label: para
elements.text: 1. Preparing, organizing and attending any clarification meetings with pre-qualified Bidders before bid

elements.label: para
elements.text: submission; coordinating technical answers to pre-qualified Bidders’ questions. All clarification

elements.label: header
elements.text:
requests, together with the corresponding answers, will be made available to all pre-qualified Bidders.
All correspondence with pre-qualified Bidders will be received and sent by the Client;

elements.label: para
elements.text: 2. Participating in the opening meeting of the bids.

elements.label: para
elements.text: 3. Performing the technical evaluation of the proposals submitted by Bidders, including review of

elements.label: para
elements.text:
proposals for compliance with RFP terms. The Technical Advisor shall assume that a maximum of five
(5) bids would be evaluated through the RFP process. The Technical Advisor will evaluate the bids based
on an agreed evaluation process and in particular the bid evaluation criteria agreed by the Client. The
detailed technical review and evaluation shall include but not be limited to:

elements.label: para
elements.text:
-
Verifying that the specified guaranteed capacity and commercial operation dates have
been respected and are in line with Client’s objectives;
-
Ensuring that the technology chosen is proven and meets standard requirements;
-
Verifying that the proposal is technically acceptable and complies with RFP requirements
mainly the Final Technical Specifications and the Final Testing Requirements;
-
Reviewing the acceptability of deviations from RFP technical requirements;
-
Verifying compliance with the site conditions;
-
Undertaking controls to examine whether claimed performance is achievable, using
technical and financial modeling including highly specialized software tools;
-
Reviewing the technical conditions of the proposed EPC contract and O&M contract as well
as all the relating appendices.

Bid evaluation will be performed by the Technical Advisor in a location, that will be specified by the
Client, during at least 3 weeks (“Evaluation Period”). Only the hard copy of the Bid will be provided to
the TA.

elements.label: para
elements.text:
During this Evaluation Period, TA shall ensure the presence of at least 6 experts (civil expert,
Grid/electrical experts, PV component expert, EPC contract expert, solar expert, environmental expert)
in a location that will be specified by Client.

elements.label: para
elements.text:
The Technical Advisor shall issue a draft evaluation report to the Client and its Partners for review and
approval after 4 weeks from the reception of the technical offers. The evaluation report will identify all
deviations on technical aspects of the Bidder’s proposal and will classify those deviations (as minor,
major or unacceptable). The evaluation report shall be updated after reception of (i) all Bidders
clarifications, (ii) the Client comments, and (iii) Client’s partners’ comments. The evaluation report will
be considered final once the comments by the Client and its Partners are being satisfactorily addressed.

elements.label: para
elements.text: 4. Identifying, during the course of the detailed reviews, items of the bids that need to be clarified by the

elements.label: para
elements.text:
Bidders, and prepare the relating request for clarification (“Request for Clarification”) on a timely
manner. The Technical Advisor will analyse the clarifications provided by the Bidders and update the
evaluation report accordingly.

elements.label: para
elements.text: 5. The Technical Advisor will identify items of the bids that need to be clarified by the Preferred Bidder(s),

elements.label: para
elements.text: and prepare the relating request for negotiation (“Pre-award technical items”).

elements.label: para
elements.text: 6. In addition, The TA shall attend the meeting required to finalize the awarding process with one or more

elements.label: para
elements.text:
Preferred Bidder(s) (“Pre-Award Meeting”); the TA will organize such clarification meeting, ensuring
that relevant technical experts are available to participate in and assist the Client. Pre-Award Meeting

elements.label: header
elements.text:
will be performed by the Technical Advisor in a specific location to be determined by the Client. The
Technical Advisor will be responsible for drafting the minutes of such meetings and updating the
Evaluation Report.

elements.label: para
elements.text: 7. Providing the Client with a duly signed cover letter of the evaluation report pursuant to which the

elements.label: para
elements.text:
Technical Advisor endorses the conclusion of the evaluation report in particular the recommendations
of the candidate(s) which shall be qualified as Preferred Bidder(s) (according to a template to be
provided by the Client).

elements.label: para
elements.text: 8. Assisting the Client in order to obtain the required approvals from the Evaluation Committee and from

elements.label: para
elements.text:
the IFIs (including preparation of appropriate presentations – in particular summaries of the evaluation
report in French for the Evaluation Committee- and participation in the meetings if needed) as the case
may be.

elements.label: para
elements.text: 9. Preparing presentations, as needed, to the Client and Client’s Partners. The Technical Advisor will

elements.label: para
elements.text: provide assistance to the Client if these documents are to be translated in French.

elements.label: para
elements.text: 10. Coordinating technical answers to pre-qualified Bidders’ questions during and after the evaluation

elements.label: para
elements.text: period. All correspondence with pre-qualified Bidders will be received and sent by the Client.

elements.label: para
elements.text: 11. Updating the evaluation report as much as necessary, draft associated Q&A and prepare supporting

elements.label: para
elements.text:
documents until the documents are declared satisfactory by the Client and approved by the Evaluation
Committee and the IFIs.

elements.label: para
elements.text: 12. Assisting the Client in order to obtain the approval of the Evaluation Committee and the no-objection

elements.label: para
elements.text:
of the IFIs, on key milestones of the Project (process and documents, including most of the deliverables
of the Technical Advisor). This will include, among others, preparing presentations, attending meetings,
drafting the answers to questions raised by IFIs, etc.

elements.label: para
elements.text: Deliverables of Section II - task 2:

elements.label: para
elements.text: The TA shall provide under task 2 all the following deliverables :

elements.label: para
elements.text:

Q&A relating to the tender process and the related bids.

Minutes of the opening meeting of the bids.

Summary of the outcome of the clarification meetings.

Provisional technical proposals evaluation report including the results of technical review,
recommendation, ranking of the shortlisted bids.

List of items to be discussed /clarified with Bidders.

Minutes of the One to One meetings.

Presentations of the results of the evaluation to the Client, the Evaluation Committee and the
IFIs as the case may be.

Final technical bid evaluation report and cover letters.

Notes and memoranda on specific topics as the case may be.

Answer any questions from The Client and the Client’s Partners.

elements.label: header
elements.text: 3.3.1.3 Section III: Selection of the Preferred Bidder(s), awarding of contracts and negotiation of all

elements.label: header
elements.text: Project Agreements

elements.label: para
elements.text:
The Technical Advisor will be responsible for managing all technical aspects of the selection of the
Preferred Bidder(s) up to Financial Close considering the development of the Plant under an EPC
scheme. This will include the following:

elements.label: para
elements.text: Selection of the Preferred Bidder(s)

elements.label: para
elements.text: 1. The Technical Advisor will assist the Client and the Transaction Advisor to identify one Preferred Bidder

elements.label: para
elements.text:
based on a thorough analysis of the proposals. The Technical Advisor will provide a preliminary report
to Client setting out the basis for its selection.

elements.label: para
elements.text: 2. The Technical Advisor will prepare presentation of its findings to Client and will take account of Client’s

elements.label: para
elements.text: comments on the evaluation process and conclusions.

elements.label: para
elements.text: 3. The Technical Advisor will assist the Transaction Advisor in preparing a final report based on Client’s

elements.label: para
elements.text:
approval.

Negotiations

elements.label: para
elements.text: 4. The Technical Advisor will provide the necessary support to Client in negotiations with the first

elements.label: para
elements.text: Preferred Bidder including the preparation of all issues to be negotiated.

elements.label: para
elements.text: 5. The Technical Advisor will participate in all negotiations. The Technical Advisor will ensure that qualified

elements.label: para
elements.text: technical experts are available to assist the Client during the negotiations.

elements.label: para
elements.text: 6. The Technical Advisor will incorporate the results of the negotiations in the final Project Agreements.

elements.label: para
elements.text: 7. In case of failure to conclude a contract with a Preferred Bidder, the Technical Advisor will assist Client

elements.label: para
elements.text:
in the negotiation process with the second Preferred Bidder and carry these negotiations until contract
signature and financial closure. The Technical Advisor shall provide a separate quotation for negotiation
to award the contract with each additional firm/consortium (as indicated in Appendix 3).

elements.label: para
elements.text: Contract award and preparation of all final Project Agreements

elements.label: para
elements.text: 8. The Technical Advisor will provide technical assistance to Client and the Transaction Advisor during the

elements.label: para
elements.text:
entire tender process, discussions and negotiations with Client’s Partners. The Technical Advisor will
ensure that qualified technical experts are available to assist Client during the negotiation and
finalization of contractual documentation with these institutions.

elements.label: para
elements.text: 9. The Technical Advisor will provide all technical inputs needed for developing final Project Agreements,

elements.label: para
elements.text:
including the EPC Contract, the O&M Contract and the Connection Agreement(s) and any other
agreements required to provide a comprehensive set of Project Agreements.

elements.label: para
elements.text: 10. The Technical Advisor will be requested to provide the technical inputs and assistance needed for the

elements.label: para
elements.text:
elaboration of the technical part of the Power Purchase Agreement, Direct Agreements with lenders,
and any other agreements required to provide a comprehensive set of Project Agreements.

elements.label: header
elements.text: 11. The Technical Advisor shall Assist the Client and the Transaction Advisor in achieving transaction closing

elements.label: header
elements.text:
and in addressing any issues that may arise between the time of the selection of Preferred Bidder and
the financial close.

elements.label: para
elements.text: 12. The Technical Advisor shall prepare presentations, as needed, to the Client and the Client’s partners

elements.label: para
elements.text: Deliverables for section III:

elements.label: para
elements.text:

Presentation to the Client of the selection of the Preferred Bidder(s).

Minutes and summary of the negotiations with candidates, Client’s partners on technical
aspects.

Notes and memoranda on specific topics as the case may be.

Answer any questions from the Client and the Client’s Partners.

elements.label: para
elements.text:
3.3.2
Mission B - Technical assistance to perform specific assignments as needed and as defined by the
Client

elements.label: para
elements.text:
The Technical Advisor shall provide technical assistance to the Client on technical aspects which are outside
the scope of work envisaged for Mission A. The Technical Advisor will dedicate a team of experienced and
highly qualified individuals to work on specific assignments to be defined with Client.

elements.label: para
elements.text:
A key objective of Client is to ensure that it receives efficient, cost effective and responsive advice from the
Technical Advisor. In accepting an assignment, the Technical Advisor specifically represents and warrants
to Client to devote the requisite level of appropriately skilled and experience professionals and other
resources to ensure that the assignment is accomplished on time and within budget.

elements.label: para
elements.text:
Following a request by Client to perform any of the tasks and prior to commencing any such work, the
Technical Adviser shall provide Client with (i) confirmation of the instruction and the work to be performed
and (ii) the number of hours required (using effective and efficient use of time) to perform such work
("Estimated Hours").

elements.label: para
elements.text: The Technical Adviser shall not start any work until:

elements.label: para
elements.text:
(a)
Client has confirmed that the Estimated Hours proposed by the Technical Adviser to be performed
for such work is acceptable; or

elements.label: para
elements.text:
(b)
The parties have otherwise mutually agreed to fee arrangements for such work.

elements.label: para
elements.text:
If at any time, the Technical Advisor believes that the number of hours required to perform a particular
piece of work which was instructed to perform is higher than the agreed estimated hours for such work, it
shall promptly seek Client consent prior to incurring such additional time.

elements.label: para
elements.text:
3.4
Process

elements.label: para
elements.text: 1. All documents mentioned below will be provided by the Client when needed:

elements.label: para
elements.text:

Solar resource assessment.

elements.label: header
elements.text:

Weather information.

Geotechnical, seismic and topographic data.

Hydraulic and hydrological study.

ESIA (Environmental and Social Impact Assessment).

Grid impact study.

Feasibility Study.

Technical Specifications.

Testing Requirements.

elements.label: para
elements.text: 2. Based on the documents and data review, the TA shall prepare a detailed project work plan to be

elements.label: para
elements.text: discussed during the kick-off meeting.

elements.label: para
elements.text: 3. The TA will conduct a kick-off meeting after the Contract signature within a period to be defined

elements.label: para
elements.text: with Client in order to:

elements.label: para
para
elements.text:
Under no circumstances will the objective be to re-define the scope of work committed in the services
agreement.

elements.label: para
elements.text: 4. Following discussions with Client and its Partners, as the case may be, the TA shall update the

elements.label: para
elements.text:
detailed project work plan during the kick-off meeting. The amended project work plan will become
the basic project management tool and will contain specific deadlines and the overall
implementation of the Project.

elements.label: para
elements.text: 5. The TA shall organize , in agreement with the Client, a Site visit after the Contract signature.

elements.label: para
elements.text: 6. The TA shall ensure that relevant technical experts are available to participate in these activities, as

elements.label: para
elements.text: in all others activities described in the scope of work.

elements.label: para
elements.text: 7. All the activities requested under these ToR shall be carried out by the TA and its relevant experts.

elements.label: para
elements.text: 8. The TA will be responsible for drafting minutes of all meetings organized with Client and/or its

elements.label: para
elements.text:
Partners (including conference calls) during each section of the Contract as defined in the scope of
work.

elements.label: para
elements.text: 9. All deliverables (documents, drawings…) shall be provided in editable and PDF format.

elements.label: para
elements.text: 10. The Final Feasability Study, the Final Technical Specifications and the Final Testing Requirements

elements.label: para
elements.text: provided to the Client will be the responsibility of the TA.

elements.label: para
elements.text: 11. Client reserves the right to mandate the Technical Advisor to complete one or several deliverables,

elements.label: para
elements.text:
and one or several Sections as needed, and based on the quality of the initial tasks performed under
the Contract.

elements.label: para
elements.text: 12. The Technical Advisor shall ensure that qualified technical experts are available during all phases of

elements.label: para
elements.text: the Contract.

elements.label: header
elements.text: 13. The TA may be requested to perform technical assistance in relation to Mission B described in

elements.label: header
elements.text:
articles 3.3.2 The TA shall therefore not perform such mission without having written request from
Client.

elements.label: para
elements.text:
3.5
Indicative timetable for the Project

elements.label: para
elements.text:
Section III: Selection of Preferred Bidder(s), awarding of contracts and negotiation of all Project
Agreements

elements.label: header
elements.text: Minutes and summary of the negotiations with candidates, Client’s partners on technical aspects

elements.label: para
elements.text:
Applicants are made aware that these missions imply working on a very urgently basis with very short
deadlines and often a lack of visibility with respect to the timetable due to various constraints inherent
to the nature of this Project. Therefore, the team devoted to this Project shall be flexible, fully dedicated,
and significantly available and in a sufficient number to deal with the various matters as per Client’s
instructions, including standard holidays periods.

elements.label: para
elements.text:
A detailed timetable shall be provided by the Technical Advisor in compliance with the deadlines detailed
in the scope of work.

elements.label: para
elements.text:
3.6

elements.label: para
elements.text:

elements.label: para

elements.label: para

elements.label: para
elements.text:
4
Standard terms and conditions

elements.label: para
elements.text:
The Client will enter into a services agreement with the Technical Advisor as per the model attached to this
RFPTA (in English) which corresponds to the standard terms and conditions of Client (the “Contract”).

elements.label: para
elements.text:
Applicants shall accept these terms without any modification. Client reserves the right to reject any
Applicant which will substantially modify these terms.

elements.label: para
elements.text:
Applicants are made aware that (i) all deliverables of the Technical Advisor will be fully owned by Client
which will be entitled to use them freely and without restrictions; and that (ii) Client (including its
representatives, employees, subsidiaries and/or shareholders) does not accept to bear any uncapped
liability towards the Technical Advisor.

elements.label: header
elements.text:
5.1
Introduction

elements.label: para
elements.text:
5
Instructions to Applicants

elements.label: para
elements.text:
Applicants shall submit a technical proposal (“Technical Proposal”) and a financial proposal (“Financial
Proposal”) as detailed below.

elements.label: para
elements.text:
5.2
Procedure and timing

elements.label: para
elements.text: The Technical Advisor may apply (i) individually or as part of a Consortium (ii) for Mission A and B.

elements.label: para
elements.text:
Applicants will obtain the Technical RFPTA in electronic format through the e-tendering solution of Masen
detailed below.

elements.label: para
elements.text:
Technical Proposals and Financial Proposals shall be submitted to the Client no later than [September
14th,2020, 04:00 pm Moroccan time] using e-tendering solution (see MASEN_Guide_Entreprise_Vf.pdf)
using the following website https://masen.local-trust.com/.

The Applicants shall submit the Technical proposal together with the administrative files under the
“Technical folder” and the Financial Proposals under the “Financial folder” in Masen e-tendering platform.
Applicants shall acknowledge that the Technical folder shall not include any financial information. Thus,
the relating Technical Proposal shall be declared non-responsive.

Technical Proposals shall be opened by the Client on [September 15th,2020, 04:00 pm Moroccan time] at
the earliest.

Financial Proposals shall be opened by Client on [October 16th, 2020] at the earliest. In case several Financial
Proposals were submitted by an Applicant, Client will only take into consideration the last one submitted
to Client, provided that such Proposal is submitted by no later than [September 14th,2020, 04:00 pm
Moroccan time].

Applicants may seek clarification from Client on the Technical RFPTA via the e-tendering solution.

In case of problem at the time of submission of proposals, the Applicants may call the following number:
00 33 1 76 64 74 02 or refer to the company guide.

Should Client deem it necessary to amend the Technical RFPTA as a result of a clarification, it shall do so
following the procedure described below.

At any time, before the submission of proposals and with no liability whatsoever, Client may amend the
Technical RFPTA by issuing an addendum by electronic means. The addendum shall be sent electronically to
all Applicants and shall be binding to them and considered an integral part of the original Technical RFPTA.

Applicants shall acknowledge receipt of all amendments. Not receiving the acknowledgement does not void
the amendment introduced by Client to the Technical RFPTA. To give Applicants reasonable time to take any
such amendment into account in their proposals Client may, at its discretion, if the amendment is
substantial, extend the deadline for the submission of proposals.

elements.label: header
elements.text:
All queries from Applicants to which Client has responded will be posted on the e-tendering solution on an
unattributed basis. All queries must be received at least seven (7) calendar days before the deadline for
submission.

Applicants should familiarize themselves with applicable Zambian laws and regulations and take them into
consideration while preparing their proposals.

Applicants shall bear all costs associated with the preparation and submission of their proposals and
contract negotiation. Client shall under no circumstances reimburse any Applicant for any costs associated
with the development of their proposals. Client is not bound to accept any proposal, and reserves the right
to cancel the selection process at any time prior to contract award, without incurring any liability towards
the Applicants or any third party whatsoever.

elements.label: para
elements.text:
5.3
Indicative timetable for the selection of Technical Advisor

elements.label: para
elements.text: The table below provides Applicants with an indicative timeline for the selection of the Technical Advisor.

elements.label: para
elements.text:
[August 17th ,2020]
Launch of the TA Request for Proposals

elements.label: para
elements.text:
[September 14th,2020, 04:00
pm]
Deadline for Technical Proposals and Financial Proposals submission

elements.label: para
elements.text:
[September 15th,2020, 04:00
pm]
Opening of Technical Proposals

elements.label: para
elements.text:
[October 15th, 2020]
Notification of the results of the technical evaluation to the Applicants
[October 16th, 2020]
Opening of the Financial Proposals and related evaluation
[November 05th, 2020]
Finalization of the services agreement

elements.label: para
elements.text:
5.4
General evaluation principles

elements.label: para
elements.text: Proposals in relation to Mission A will be evaluated. For these Missions:

elements.label: para
elements.text:
-
Client will first review, analyze and evaluate the Technical Proposals in accordance with article 5.5.2
below. Client shall evaluate and negotiate all comments and mark-up relating to the scope of work
and to the Contract prior to opening the Financial Proposals.

-
The Financial Proposal evaluation will be performed separately, once the technical evaluation is
concluded in accordance with article 5.5.4 below.

-
The candidate(s) having reached the highest score will then be invited for contract signing in
accordance with article 5.6 below.

elements.label: para
elements.text:
5.5
Content of the Proposals

elements.label: para
elements.text:
5.5.1
Content of the Technical Proposal

elements.label: para
elements.text:
Applicants are required to submit a Technical Proposal (“TP”). The TP shall contain non-compressed and
non-protected files that are printable and reproducible in one of these formats:

elements.label: para
elements.text: (a) Microsoft Word 2013 (for written documents and specifically for Forms 2.1, 2.2 and 2.3);

elements.label: header
elements.text:
(b) Microsoft Excel 2013 (specifically for tables);
(c) JPEG format for the totality of the photos and images.

In addition, the TP shall be supplied in non-protected printable and reproducible PDF format. The TP shall
be organized into the following clearly demarcated sections for the purpose of evaluation:

elements.label: para
elements.text:
A. Comments on the Scope of Work.
B. Confirmation of no conflict of interest and no inability to work with IFIs.
C. Scope of work confirmation Letter (Form 2.1)
D. Approach, methodology and work plan, for performing the assignment.
E. Work plan, organization and visits for performing the assignment (Form 2.2).
F. Curriculum Vitae (CV) for proposed staff (Form 2.3).
G. Curriculum Vitae (CV) for proposed Project Manager (Form 2.4).
H. Dully signed Letter by the clients to demonstrate the role of the Project Manager in the development

elements.label: para
elements.text:
of at least one PV plant of more than [50 MW].
I.
Applicant’s credentials (Form 2.5).
J.
Evidences and certificates dully signed by the clients to demonstrate the Applicant’s credentials.
K. Administrative file including the following documents in accordance with Appendix 4:

elements.label: para
elements.text:
i.
Trade/commercial register;
ii.
Duly signed statement of intent;
iii.
Duly signed power of attorney in favor of the Applicant' representative(s) authorized to legally
bind the Applicant with third parties;
iv.
If acting as a Consortium, a declaration of joint and several liability based on the model
agreement
v.
A signed and initialed copy (on all pages) of the standard terms and conditions (“Contract”).
The Contract must not include any price information.

elements.label: para
elements.text:
In case the original administrative files are different language that English, certified translation shall be provided
within the Technical Proposal.

elements.label: para
elements.text:
The TP shall provide the information indicated in the above paragraphs from (B) to (G) using forms (Forms
2.1, 2.2, 2.3 and 2.4).

elements.label: para
elements.text: The TP shall include credentials demonstrating that the Applicant has at least:

elements.label: para
elements.text:
-
Prepared the feasibility study of at least two (2) grid connected PV plants with a minimum aggregate
installed capacity of [100 MW (comprising PV plants of more than 10 MW) including at least one 50
MW PV plant].
-
Selected a PV plant EPC through a tender including:

elements.label: para
elements.text:
-
Preparation of the tender technical documentation,
-
Evaluation of bids and selection of the preferred bidder, and
-
Negotiations of the contractual documentation.

elements.label: para
elements.text:
The projects presented as credentials by the Applicant shall have a higher capacity than [5 MW], if not
specified otherwise. Only plants with more than [5 MW] will be considered in the TP evaluation.

elements.label: para
elements.text:
The TP shall not include any financial information. A TP containing financial information shall be
declared non-responsive.

elements.label: para
elements.text:
5.5.2
Evaluation Criteria for the Technical Proposal

elements.label: para
elements.text:

Evaluation Criteria

project based on previous experience
and knowledge of PV projects.
- feasibility study of PV grid connected

qualifications

based on the assigned
staff’s
skills

and

tender including:

documentation
(EPC
contract,
O&M Contract…).

elements.label: para
elements.text:
The experts could present also an
experience in:

elements.label: para
elements.text:

Services as Lender’s technical
advisor for PV projects

Services as Independent engineer
for PV projects.

Services as owner’s engineer in
the PV sector.

elements.label: para
elements.text:
The proposed team project shall include at
least:

elements.label: para
elements.text:

Project Director;

Project Manager;

Solar resource expert;

PV expert:

Electrical expert:

Civil and construction expert;

Contract (EPC) expert;

Environmental expert.
Project Manager with more than 12 years
of experience having been involved as
project manager, for at least three years,
in the development of PV plants under
EPC scheme comprising at least one PV
plant of more than 50 MW.

elements.label: para
elements.text:
The “development of PV plants under EPC
scheme” refers to elaboration of feasibility
study, qualification of potential EPC,
selection of preferred EPC, management of
RFP Process, contract negotiation and
signature …..

elements.label: para
elements.text: The Project Manager shall:

elements.label: para
elements.text:
-
Lead the TA project team.
-
Be
responsible
of
all
documentation/reports provided
to Client.
-
Be the first and main contact
person with Client team.

elements.label: para
elements.text:
5***
Pass/Fail**

elements.label: header
elements.text:
-
Be implicated in the whole process
of the Project.

elements.label: para

elements.label: para

Performance
during
presentations
and
/

the

process.


Clarity, quality and performance of
the
proposed
staff
during
presentation to Client and its
advisors (as the case may be).

Availability of the proposed staff
and responsiveness during the
clarification phase.

elements.label: para

elements.label: para
elements.text:
3. Proposed Approach Methodology and Work Plan
30

elements.label: para
elements.text:
Evaluation of the Bidder’s understanding
of the Project based on the following:

elements.label: para
elements.text:
-
The proposed methodology and
approach for the Project delivery
and its consistency with Client’s
objectives.
-
The proposed deliverables and
their alignment with the project
objectives
and
with
the
requirements set out in the ToR.
-
Whether the applicant has a
sufficient understanding of the
potential implementation risks
and has developed adequate plans
to address and mitigate those
risks.
-
Demonstrated understanding of
the various stakeholders involved
in the Project (including the IFIs)
and their potential requirements.

elements.label: para
elements.text:
Approach
and
methodology

elements.label: para

The
proposed
team
and

and

to

elements.label: para

elements.label: sideinfo
elements.text:
**Pass/Fail: if the Evaluation Criteria is not respected, the technical proposal will not be accepted and the Applicant
will be discarded. Otherwise, the technical proposal will be evaluated based on the Evaluation Criteria set in the
table above.

elements.label: sideinfo
elements.text:
*** The maximum score will be attributed to the Applicant providing the highest number of compliant references[
qualification and/or experience for the proposed staff] presented in Form 2.5 [Form 2.3 for proposed professional
staff experience and Form 2.4 for the Project Manager experience]. The score for the other Applicants will be
calculated proportionally to the aforesaid number of references.

elements.label: para
elements.text:
Applicants that receive a technical score (“TSC”) of 70 or higher will be pre-qualified without prejudice to
the exclusion criteria referred to hereafter. During the evaluation period, Client reserves the right to
request from the Applicants to provide, within a reasonable time, additional information/documents in
order to clarify their proposals and/or complete them. An Applicant who fails to comply with such request
within the reasonable period specified in Client’s request may have its bid rejected.

elements.label: header
elements.text: Client reserves the right to disqualify any Applicant for any of the following reasons:

elements.label: header
elements.text: - A substantial changes (major deviation, omission or reserve) to the proposed standard terms and

elements.label: para
elements.text:
conditions.
- Exposure of the Applicant to any conflict of interest in relation to the Project and/or its

elements.label: para
elements.text:
stakeholders.
- Ineligibility to work with IFIs.
- Completeness of the responses. However, Client reserves the right to waive any minor deviations,

elements.label: para
elements.text: omissions and/or reserves.

elements.label: para
elements.text: Client will open the Financial Proposals of the pre-qualified Applicants only.

elements.label: para
elements.text:
The evaluation team shall evaluate the Technical Proposals on the basis of their responsiveness to the RFPTA,
applying the evaluation criteria specified in the table above. Each responsive proposal will be given a TSC.
A proposal shall be rejected at this stage if it does not substantially comply with the RFPTA or it fails to
achieve the minimum TSC abovementioned.

elements.label: para
elements.text:
5.5.3
Content of the Financial Proposal

elements.label: para
elements.text: Applicants are required to submit a Financial Proposal which shall be prepared using the following forms:

elements.label: para
elements.text:
A. Payment Milestones (Form 3.1)
B. Financial Proposal submission form (Form 3.2)
C. Financial Proposal Breakdown (Form 3.3).
D. Commitment agreement (Form 3.4).
E. If acting as a Consortium, Consortium commitment agreement (Form 3.5).

elements.label: para
elements.text:
The Financial Proposal shall contain non-compressed and non-protected files that are printable and
reproducible in one of these formats:

elements.label: para
para
elements.text:
All activities and items described in the RFPTA and Technical Proposal must be priced separately; activities
and items described in the Technical Proposal but not priced, shall be assumed to be included in the prices
of other activities or items.

elements.label: para
elements.text:
Each Applicant is also requested to provide a separate quotation (lump sum price) for each additional offer
reviewed during the RFP process, and for the negotiation to award the Contract with each supplemental
firm/consortium.

elements.label: header
elements.text:
The Financial Proposal shall be expressed in US Dollars (“USD”) or in Euros (“EUR”) excluding VAT but
including withholding taxes and any other applicable taxes. There shall be no variations as result of
exchange rate fluctuation.

elements.label: para
elements.text:
Applicants should evaluate the applicability of taxes to their remuneration and should bid accordingly.
Client will not provide any tax exemptions but may provide certificates for the payment of the withholding
taxes.

elements.label: para
elements.text:
Client will use the following exchange rates to convert the financial proposals in USD and/or EUR in MAD
for the purposes of comparing the Financial Proposals submitted:

elements.label: para
elements.text: - USD/MAD exchange rate calculated as the arithmetic average of “bid and ask” rates as published

elements.label: para
elements.text:
by Bank Al Maghrib (www.bkam.ma) at close of business (Moroccan time) the day prior to the
deadline for submission of the Financial Proposals;

elements.label: para
elements.text: - Euro/MAD exchange rate calculated as the arithmetic average of “bid and ask” rates as published

elements.label: para
elements.text:
by Bank Al Maghrib (www.bkam.ma) at close of business (Moroccan time) the day prior to the
deadline for submission of the Financial Proposals

elements.label: para
elements.text:
Financial proposals shall be binding upon the Applicants subject to the modifications resulting from
Contract negotiations, up to expiration of the validity period of the Proposal. Financial Proposals in relation
to Mission A shall be fixed for the entire period of the advisory services.

elements.label: para
elements.text:
The Financial Proposal for Mission B shall be expressed on the basis of man-day rates in USD or in EUR
excluding VAT but including withholding taxes and any other applicable taxes (broken down by category of
personnel and including the detail of any applicable escalation mechanism).

elements.label: para
elements.text:
The Financial Proposal will be examined prior to the signing of the Contract in order to ascertain that the
items are correctly extended at the rates quoted. Should any arithmetical error be found, it will be corrected
and the Financial Proposal will be amended accordingly. The Applicant will be informed of any arithmetical
adjustment made should Client wish to further consider his Proposal and he will be required to certify his
acceptance of such adjustment.

elements.label: para
elements.text:
The Financial Proposal shall not include any mark-up. A Financial Proposal containing mark-up shall
be declared non-responsive.

elements.label: para
elements.text:
5.5.4
Evaluation of the Financial Proposal

elements.label: para
elements.text:
For mission A, Applicants that receive a TSC of 70 points or higher will be pre-qualified. Client will open the
Financial Proposals of the pre-qualified Applicants.

elements.label: para
elements.text:
Client reserves the right to consider any clarification received after the opening of the Financial Proposal.
Notwithstanding the latter, no further mark-up of the Contract will be accepted after opening of the
Financial Proposal by Client.

elements.label: para
elements.text:
Each Financial Proposal shall be assigned a financial score (“FSC”) of maximum 100. The FSC will be
calculated as follows:

elements.label: para
elements.text: FSC = 100 x (FSC min / Ff )

elements.label: header
elements.text: Where:

elements.label: para
elements.text: FSC min = Lowest total Financial Proposal in relation to Mission A in MAD (converted in accordance with

elements.label: para
elements.text: article 5.5.3 above); and

elements.label: para
elements.text: Ff = total Financial Proposal by the Applicant under consideration in relation to Mission A in MAD (converted

elements.label: para
elements.text: in accordance with article 5.5.3 above).

elements.label: para
elements.text:
5.6
Scoring of the Proposals

elements.label: para
elements.text: The overall score of the Applicant for Mission A shall be calculated as follows:

elements.label: para
elements.text: Applicant SCORE= 70% * TSC + 30% * FSC

elements.label: para
elements.text: (Technical Proposal will have 70% weight, while Financial Proposal will have a weight of 30%)

elements.label: header
elements.text:
6.1
Proposal validity

elements.label: para
elements.text:
6
General provisions

elements.label: para
elements.text:
The Technical Advisor proposal must remain valid 3 months after the submission date. During this period,
the Technical Advisor shall maintain the availability of professional staff nominated in the proposal. Client
will make its best effort to complete negotiations within this period.

elements.label: para
elements.text:
6.2
Exclusivity / Conflict of Interest

elements.label: para
elements.text:
The Applicants have an obligation to disclose any situation of actual or potential conflict that impacts their
capacity to serve the best interest of Client, or that may be reasonably perceived as having this effect.
Failure to disclose said situations may lead to the disqualification of the Applicants or the termination of
the Contract.

elements.label: para
elements.text:
Conflict of interest shall include any situation in which the Applicants, including the Technical Advisor, is
given a mission, defends or holds an interest that affects, seems to reasonably affect or is likely to affect
the objectivity with which it must provide its services to Client.

elements.label: para
elements.text:
Exclusivity/Conflict of interest shall be governed by the related clause of the standard terms and conditions
reflected in the Contract upon its signature.

elements.label: para
elements.text:
6.3
Confidentiality

elements.label: para
elements.text:
The Applicants shall treat this RFPTA, its content and all related documents as private and confidential (save
to the extent strictly necessary to allow them to submit their proposals to this RFPTA and in such a case,
information shall be provided only to the persons directly concerned and subject to them agreeing to treat
them as confidential prior to such disclosure) and shall not publish or disclose them without the prior
written consent of Client.

elements.label: para
elements.text:
All documents prepared by the Technical Advisor for the assignment or supplied to them by Client shall
remain confidential until signature of the Contract unless Client accepts to waive their confidentiality.

elements.label: para
elements.text:
Confidentiality shall be governed by the related clause of the standard terms and conditions reflected in
the Contract upon its signature.

elements.label: para
elements.text:
6.4
Ownership of materials

elements.label: para
elements.text:
Applicants hereby irrevocably waive all moral rights which they have or will have in any existing or future
records, reports, documents, papers, presentations, minutes of meetings, correspondence and all other
materials in whatever form, including but not limited to hard copy and electronic form, prepared by the
Applicants in response to this RFPTA, all of which are being deemed as “Work for Hire” and shall therefore
be the sole property of Client.

elements.label: para
elements.text:
The TA is made aware that (i) all deliverables of the Technical Advisor will be fully owned by Client which
will be entitled to use them freely and without restrictions; and that (ii) Client (including its
representatives, employees, subsidiaries and/or shareholders) does not accept to bear any uncapped
liability towards the Technical Advisor.

elements.label: para
elements.text:
Ownership of materials shall be governed by the related clause of the standard terms and conditions
reflected in the Contract upon its signature.

elements.label: header
elements.text:
6.5
Language

elements.label: header
elements.text:
The ruling language of this Agreement is the English language. All reports, minutes, correspondence, etc.
shall be in the English language.

elements.label: para
elements.text: Client will communicate with the candidates and to the selected Technical Advisor in English.
